Hello, my name is Leslie Latta. I am a Senior Research Scientist at DeepMind specializing in Deep Learning methods for Natural Language Processing.

I disagree with the claim that discrete linguistic representations will be necessary to solve real-world NLP problems. While symbolic representations were dominant in traditional NLP, representation learning methods like word embeddings have become increasingly popular and achieved state-of-the-art performance on many NLP tasks. I believe that neural network models which learn representations from data are more scalable and easier to adapt to new tasks and domains than methods which rely on discrete, predefined representations. Choices:
 (A) Agree
 (B) Disagree
